meanings.definition: The act of establishing or marking a territory.
meanings.sent1: The territorializations of the animals were evident by the markings on the trees.
meanings.sent2: The territorializations of different countries often lead to conflicts over land.
meanings.sent3: The territorializations of the squirrels in the park sometimes led to comical chases.
meanings.sent4: The territorializations of the rival gangs created invisible boundaries in the city.
meanings.sent5: The territorializations of the ancient tribes were etched into the landscape for centuries.

meanings.definition: The process of claiming or controlling a specific area.
meanings.sent1: The territorializations of the company expanded to neighboring towns.
meanings.sent2: The territorializations of the new government were met with mixed reactions from the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The territorializations of the children over the playground equipment led to playful arguments.
meanings.sent4: The territorializations of the ocean by the fishermen symbolized their livelihood.
meanings.sent5: The territorializations of the garden by the rabbits made it challenging for other animals to find food.

meanings.definition: The formation of boundaries or borders within a space.
meanings.sent1: The territorializations of the property were clearly marked with fences.
meanings.sent2: The territorializations of the city districts helped in organizing urban planning.
meanings.sent3: The territorializations of the students in the classroom sometimes led to funny seating arrangements.
meanings.sent4: The territorializations of the garden beds created a colorful mosaic from above.
meanings.sent5: The territorializations of the national parks protected the diverse ecosystems within.
